        "$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/base": {
            "title": "$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/base",
            "tags": "[[$:/tags/Stylesheet]]",
            "text": "\\define custom-background-datauri()\n<$set name=\"background\" value={{$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/backgroundimage}}>\n<$list filter=\"[<background>is[image]]\">\n`background: url(`\n<$list filter=\"[<background>!has[_canonical_uri]]\">\n<$macrocall $name=\"datauri\" title={{$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/backgroundimage}}/>\n</$list>\n<$list filter=\"[<background>has[_canonical_uri]]\">\n<$view tiddler={{$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/backgroundimage}} field=\"_canonical_uri\"/>\n</$list>\n`) center center;`\n`background-attachment: `{{$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/backgroundimageattachment}}`;\n-webkit-background-size:` {{$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/backgroundimagesize}}`;\n-moz-background-size:` {{$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/backgroundimagesize}}`;\n-o-background-size:` {{$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/backgroundimagesize}}`;\nbackground-size:` {{$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/backgroundimagesize}}`;`\n</$list>\n</$set>\n\\end\n\n\\define if-fluid-fixed(text,hiddenSidebarText)\n<$reveal state=\"$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/options/sidebarlayout\" type=\"match\" text=\"fluid-fixed\">\n$text$\n<$reveal state=\"$:/state/sidebar\" type=\"nomatch\" text=\"yes\" default=\"yes\">\n$hiddenSidebarText$\n</$reveal>\n</$reveal>\n\\end\n\n\\define if-editor-height-fixed(then,else)\n<$reveal state=\"$:/config/TextEditor/EditorHeight/Mode\" type=\"match\" text=\"fixed\">\n$then$\n</$reveal>\n<$reveal state=\"$:/config/TextEditor/EditorHeight/Mode\" type=\"match\" text=\"auto\">\n$else$\n</$reveal>\n\\end\n\n\\rules only filteredtranscludeinline transcludeinline macrodef macrocallinline macrocallblock\n\n/*\n** Start with the normalize CSS reset, and then belay some of its effects\n*/\n\n{{$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/reset}}\n\n*, input[type=\"search\"] {\n\tbox-sizing: border-box;\n\t-moz-box-sizing: border-box;\n\t-webkit-box-sizing: border-box;\n}\n\nhtml button {\n\tline-height: 1.2;\n\tcolor: <<colour button-foreground>>;\n\tbackground: <<colour button-background>>;\n\tborder-color: <<colour button-border>>;\n}\n\n/*\n** Basic element styles\n*/\n\nhtml {\n\tfont-family: {{$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/fontfamily}};\n\ttext-rendering: optimizeLegibility; /* Enables kerning and ligatures etc. */\n\t-webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;\n\t-moz-osx-font-smoothing: grayscale;\n}\n\nhtml:-webkit-full-screen {\n\tbackground-color: <<colour page-background>>;\n}\n\nbody.tc-body {\n\tfont-size: {{$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/metrics/fontsize}};\n\tline-height: {{$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/metrics/lineheight}};\n\tword-wrap: break-word;\n\t<<custom-background-datauri>>\n\tcolor: <<colour foreground>>;\n\tbackground-color: <<colour page-background>>;\n\tfill: <<colour foreground>>;\n}\n\nh1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6 {\n\tline-height: 1.2;\n\tfont-weight: 300;\n}\n\npre {\n\tdisplay: block;\n\tpadding: 14px;\n\tmargin-top: 1em;\n\tmargin-bottom: 1em;\n\tword-break: normal;\n\tword-wrap: break-word;\n\twhite-space: {{$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/options/codewrapping}};\n\tbackground-color: <<colour pre-background>>;\n\tborder: 1px solid <<colour pre-border>>;\n\tpadding: 0 3px 2px;\n\tborder-radius: 3px;\n\tfont-family: {{$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/codefontfamily}};\n}\n\ncode {\n\tcolor: <<colour code-foreground>>;\n\tbackground-color: <<colour code-background>>;\n\tborder: 1px solid <<colour code-border>>;\n\twhite-space: {{$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/options/codewrapping}};\n\tpadding: 0 3px 2px;\n\tborder-radius: 3px;\n\tfont-family: {{$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/codefontfamily}};\n}\n\nblockquote {\n\tborder-left: 5px solid <<colour blockquote-bar>>;\n\tmargin-left: 25px;\n\tpadding-left: 10px;\n\tquotes: \"\\201C\"\"\\201D\"\"\\2018\"\"\\2019\";\n}\n\nblockquote.tc-big-quote {\n\tfont-family: Georgia, serif;\n\tposition: relative;\n\tbackground: <<colour pre-background>>;\n\tborder-left: none;\n\tmargin-left: 50px;\n\tmargin-right: 50px;\n\tpadding: 10px;\n    border-radius: 8px;\n}\n\nblockquote.tc-big-quote cite:before {\n\tcontent: \"\\2014 \\2009\";\n}\n\nblockquote.tc-big-quote:before {\n\tfont-family: Georgia, serif;\n\tcolor: <<colour blockquote-bar>>;\n\tcontent: open-quote;\n\tfont-size: 8em;\n\tline-height: 0.1em;\n\tmargin-right: 0.25em;\n\tvertical-align: -0.4em;\n\tposition: absolute;\n    left: -50px;\n    top: 42px;\n}\n\nblockquote.tc-big-quote:after {\n\tfont-family: Georgia, serif;\n\tcolor: <<colour blockquote-bar>>;\n\tcontent: close-quote;\n\tfont-size: 8em;\n\tline-height: 0.1em;\n\tmargin-right: 0.25em;\n\tvertical-align: -0.4em;\n\tposition: absolute;\n    right: -80px;\n    bottom: -20px;\n}\n\ndl dt {\n\tfont-weight: bold;\n\tmargin-top: 6px;\n}\n\ntextarea,\ninput[type=text],\ninput[type=search],\ninput[type=\"\"],\ninput:not([type]) {\n\tcolor: <<colour foreground>>;\n\tbackground: <<colour background>>;\n}\n\n.tc-muted {\n\tcolor: <<colour muted-foreground>>;\n}\n\nsvg.tc-image-button {\n\tpadding: 0px 1px 1px 0px;\n}\n\n.tc-icon-wrapper > svg {\n\twidth: 1em;\n\theight: 1em;\n}\n\nkbd {\n\tdisplay: inline-block;\n\tpadding: 3px 5px;\n\tfont-size: 0.8em;\n\tline-height: 1.2;\n\tcolor: <<colour foreground>>;\n\tvertical-align: middle;\n\tbackground-color: <<colour background>>;\n\tborder: solid 1px <<colour muted-foreground>>;\n\tborder-bottom-color: <<colour muted-foreground>>;\n\tborder-radius: 3px;\n\tbox-shadow: inset 0 -1px 0 <<colour muted-foreground>>;\n}\n\n/*\nMarkdown likes putting code elements inside pre elements\n*/\npre > code {\n\tpadding: 0;\n\tborder: none;\n\tbackground-color: inherit;\n\tcolor: inherit;\n}\n\ntable {\n\tborder: 1px solid <<colour table-border>>;\n\twidth: auto;\n\tmax-width: 100%;\n\tcaption-side: bottom;\n\tmargin-top: 1em;\n\tmargin-bottom: 1em;\n}\n\ntable th, table td {\n\tpadding: 0 7px 0 7px;\n\tborder-top: 1px solid <<colour table-border>>;\n\tborder-left: 1px solid <<colour table-border>>;\n}\n\ntable thead tr td, table th {\n\tbackground-color: <<colour table-header-background>>;\n\tfont-weight: bold;\n}\n\ntable tfoot tr td {\n\tbackground-color: <<colour table-footer-background>>;\n}\n\n.tc-csv-table {\n\twhite-space: nowrap;\n}\n\n.tc-tiddler-frame img,\n.tc-tiddler-frame svg,\n.tc-tiddler-frame canvas,\n.tc-tiddler-frame embed,\n.tc-tiddler-frame iframe {\n\tmax-width: 100%;\n}\n\n.tc-tiddler-body > embed,\n.tc-tiddler-body > iframe {\n\twidth: 100%;\n\theight: 600px;\n}\n\n/*\n** Links\n*/\n\nbutton.tc-tiddlylink,\na.tc-tiddlylink {\n\ttext-decoration: none;\n\tfont-weight: normal;\n\tcolor: <<colour tiddler-link-foreground>>;\n\t-webkit-user-select: inherit; /* Otherwise the draggable attribute makes links impossible to select */\n}\n\n.tc-sidebar-lists a.tc-tiddlylink {\n\tcolor: <<colour sidebar-tiddler-link-foreground>>;\n}\n\n.tc-sidebar-lists a.tc-tiddlylink:hover {\n\tcolor: <<colour sidebar-tiddler-link-foreground-hover>>;\n}\n\nbutton.tc-tiddlylink:hover,\na.tc-tiddlylink:hover {\n\ttext-decoration: underline;\n}\n\na.tc-tiddlylink-resolves {\n}\n\na.tc-tiddlylink-shadow {\n\tfont-weight: bold;\n}\n\na.tc-tiddlylink-shadow.tc-tiddlylink-resolves {\n\tfont-weight: normal;\n}\n\na.tc-tiddlylink-missing {\n\tfont-style: italic;\n}\n\na.tc-tiddlylink-external bold;\n}\n\n.tc-table-of-contents li li li li {\n\tfont-size: 0.95em;\n\tfont-weight: 200;\n}\n\n.tc-tabbed-table-of-contents {\n\tdisplay: -webkit-flex;\n\tdisplay: flex;\n}\n\n.tc-tabbed-table-of-contents .tc-table-of-contents {\n\tz-index: 100;\n\tdisplay: inline-block;\n\tpadding-left: 1em;\n\tmax-width: 50%;\n\t-webkit-flex: 0 0 auto;\n\tflex: 0 0 auto;\n\tbackground: <<colour tab-background>>;\n\tborder-left: 1px solid <<colour tab-border>>;\n\tborder-top: 1px solid <<colour tab-border>>;\n\tborder-bottom: 1px solid <<colour tab-border>>;\n}\n\n.tc-tabbed-table-of-contents .tc-table-of-contents .toc-item > a,\n.tc-tabbed-table-of-contents .tc-table-of-contents .toc-item-selected > a {\n\tdisplay: block;\n\tpadding: 0.12em 1em 0.12em 0.25em;\n}\n\n.tc-tabbed-table-of-contents .tc-table-of-contents .toc-item > a {\n\tborder-top: 1px solid <<colour tab-background>>;\n\tborder-left: 1px solid <<colour tab-background>>;\n\tborder-bottom: 1px solid <<colour tab-background>>;\n}\n\n.tc-tabbed-table-of-contents .tc-table-of-contents .toc-item > a:hover {\n\ttext-decoration: none;\n\tborder-top: 1px solid <<colour tab-border>>;\n\tborder-left: 1px solid <<colour tab-border>>;\n\tborder-bottom: 1px solid <<colour tab-border>>;\n\tbackground: <<colour tab-border>>;\n}\n\n.tc-tabbed-table-of-contents .tc-table-of-contents .toc-item-selected > a {\n\tborder-top: 1px solid <<colour tab-border>>;\n\tborder-left: 1px solid <<colour tab-border>>;\n\tborder-bottom: 1px solid <<colour tab-border>>;\n\tbackground: <<colour background>>;\n\tmargin-right: -1px;\n}\n\n.tc-tabbed-table-of-contents .tc-table-of-contents .toc-item-selected > a:hover {\n\ttext-decoration: none;\n}\n\n.tc-tabbed-table-of-contents .tc-tabbed-table-of-contents-content {\n\tdisplay: inline-block;\n\tvertical-align: top;\n\tpadding-left: 1.5em;\n\tpadding-right: 1.5em;\n\tborder: 1px solid <<colour tab-border>>;\n\t-webkit-flex: 1 0 50%;\n\tflex: 1 0 50%;\n}\n\n/*\n** Dirty indicator\n*/\n\nbody.tc-dirty span.tc-dirty-indicator, body.tc-dirty span.tc-dirty-indicator svg {\n\tfill: <<colour dirty-indicator>>;\n\tcolor: <<colour dirty-indicator>>;\n}\n\n/*\n** File inputs\n*/\n\n.tc-file-input-wrapper {\n\tposition: relative;\n\toverflow: hidden;\n\tdisplay: inline-block;\n\tvertical-align: middle;\n}\n\n.tc-file-input-wrapper input[type=file] {\n\tposition: absolute;\n\ttop: 0;\n\tleft: 0;\n\tright: 0;\n\tbottom: 0;\n\tfont-size: 999px;\n\tmax-width: 100%;\n\tmax-height: 100%;\n\tfilter: alpha(opacity=0);\n\topacity: 0;\n\toutline: none;\n\tbackground: white;\n\tcursor: pointer;\n\tdisplay: inline-block;\n}\n\n/*\n** Thumbnail macros\n*/\n\n.tc-thumbnail-wrapper {\n\tposition: relative;\n\tdisplay: inline-block;\n\tmargin: 6px;\n\tvertical-align: top;\n}\n\n.tc-thumbnail-right-wrapper {\n\tfloat:right;\n\tmargin: 0.5em 0 0.5em 0.5em;\n}\n\n.tc-thumbnail-image {\n\ttext-align: center;\n\toverflow: hidden;\n\tborder-radius: 3px;\n}\n\n.tc-thumbnail-image svg,\n.tc-thumbnail-image img {\n\tfilter: alpha(opacity=1);\n\topacity: 1;\n\tmin-width: 100%;\n\tmin-height: 100%;\n\tmax-width: 100%;\n}\n\n.tc-thumbnail-wrapper:hover .tc-thumbnail-image svg,\n.tc-thumbnail-wrapper:hover .tc-thumbnail-image img {\n\tfilter: alpha(opacity=0.8);\n\topacity: 0.8;\n}\n\n.tc-thumbnail-background {\n\tposition: absolute;\n\tborder-radius: 3px;\n}\n\n.tc-thumbnail-icon svg,\n.tc-thumbnail-icon img {\n\twidth: 3em;\n\theight: 3em;\n\t<<filter \"drop-shadow(2px 2px 4px rgba(0,0,0,0.3))\">>\n}\n\n.tc-thumbnail-wrapper:hover .tc-thumbnail-icon svg,\n.tc-thumbnail-wrapper:hover .tc-thumbnail-icon img {\n\tfill: #fff;\n\t<<filter \"drop-shadow(3px 3px 4px rgba(0,0,0,0.6))\">>\n}\n\n.tc-thumbnail-icon {\n\tposition: absolute;\n\ttop: 0;\n\tleft: 0;\n\tright: 0;\n\tbottom: 0;\n\tdisplay: -webkit-flex;\n\t-webkit-align-items: center;\n\t-webkit-justify-content: center;\n\tdisplay: flex;\n\talign-items: center;\n\tjustify-content: center;\n}\n\n.tc-thumbnail-caption {\n\tposition: absolute;\n\tbackground-color: #777;\n\tcolor: #fff;\n\ttext-align: center;\n\tbottom: 0;\n\twidth: 100%;\n\tfilter: alpha(opacity=0.9);\n\topacity: 0.9;\n\tline-height: 1.4;\n\tborder-bottom-left-radius: 3px;\n\tborder-bottom-right-radius: 3px;\n}\n\n.tc-thumbnail-wrapper:hover .tc-thumbnail-caption {\n\tfilter: alpha(opacity=1);\n\topacity: 1;\n}\n\n/*\n** Errors\n*/\n\n.tc-error {\n\tbackground: #f00;\n\tcolor: #fff;\n}"

        "$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/reset": {
            "title": "$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/reset",
            "type": "text/plain",
            "text": "/*! normalize.css v3.0.0 | MIT License | git.io/normalize */\n\n/**\n * 1. Set default font family to sans-serif.\n * 2. Prevent iOS text size adjust after orientation change, without disabling\n *    user zoom.\n */\n\nhtml {\n  font-family: sans-serif; /* 1 */\n  -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; /* 2 */\n  -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; /* 2 */\n}\n\n/**\n * Remove default margin.\n */\n\nbody {\n  margin: 0;\n}\n\n/* HTML5 display definitions\n   ========================================================================== */\n\n/**\n * Correct `block` display not defined in IE 8/9.\n */\n\narticle,\naside,\ndetails,\nfigcaption,\nfigure,\nfooter,\nheader,\nhgroup,\nmain,\nnav,\nsection,\nsummary {\n  display: block;\n}\n\n/**\n * 1. Correct `inline-block` display not defined in IE 8/9.\n * 2. Normalize vertical alignment of `progress` in Chrome, Firefox, and Opera.\n */\n\naudio,\ncanvas,\nprogress,\nvideo {\n  display: inline-block; /* 1 */\n  vertical-align: baseline; /* 2 */\n}\n\n/**\n * Prevent modern browsers from displaying `audio` without controls.\n * Remove excess height in iOS 5 devices.\n */\n\naudio:not([controls]) {\n  display: none;\n  height: 0;\n}\n\n/**\n * Address `[hidden]` styling not present in IE 8/9.\n * Hide the `template` element in IE, Safari, and Firefox < 22.\n */\n\n[hidden],\ntemplate {\n  display: none;\n}\n\n/* Links\n   ========================================================================== */\n\n/**\n * Remove the gray background color from active links in IE 10.\n */\n\na {\n  background: transparent;\n}\n\n/**\n * Improve readability when focused and also mouse hovered in all browsers.\n */\n\na:active,\na:hover {\n  outline: 0;\n}\n\n/* Text-level semantics\n   ========================================================================== */\n\n/**\n * Address styling not present in IE 8/9, Safari 5, and Chrome.\n */\n\nabbr[title] {\n  border-bottom: 1px dotted;\n}\n\n/**\n * Address style set to `bolder` in Firefox 4+, Safari 5, and Chrome.\n */\n\nb,\nstrong {\n  font-weight: bold;\n}\n\n/**\n * Address styling not present in Safari 5 and Chrome.\n */\n\ndfn {\n  font-style: italic;\n}\n\n/**\n * Address variable `h1` font-size and margin within `section` and `article`\n * contexts in Firefox 4+, Safari 5, and Chrome.\n */\n\nh1 {\n  font-size: 2em;\n  margin: 0.67em 0;\n}\n\n/**\n * Address styling not present in IE 8/9.\n */\n\nmark {\n  background: #ff0;\n  color: #000;\n}\n\n/**\n * Address inconsistent and variable font size in all browsers.\n */\n\nsmall {\n  font-size: 80%;\n}\n\n/**\n * Prevent `sub` and `sup` affecting `line-height` in all browsers.\n */\n\nsub,\nsup {\n  font-size: 75%;\n  line-height: 0;\n  position: relative;\n  vertical-align: baseline;\n}\n\nsup {\n  top: -0.5em;\n}\n\nsub {\n  bottom: -0.25em;\n}\n\n/* Embedded content\n   ========================================================================== */\n\n/**\n * Remove border when inside `a` element in IE 8/9.\n */\n\nimg {\n  border: 0;\n}\n\n/**\n * Correct overflow displayed oddly in IE 9.\n */\n\nsvg:not(:root) {\n  overflow: hidden;\n}\n\n/* Grouping content\n   ========================================================================== */\n\n/**\n * Address margin not present in IE 8/9 and Safari 5.\n */\n\nfigure {\n  margin: 1em 40px;\n}\n\n/**\n * Address differences between Firefox and other browsers.\n */\n\nhr {\n  -moz-box-sizing: content-box;\n  box-sizing: content-box;\n  height: 0;\n}\n\n/**\n * Contain overflow in all browsers.\n */\n\npre {\n  overflow: auto;\n}\n\n/**\n * Address odd `em`-unit font size rendering in all browsers.\n */\n\ncode,\nkbd,\npre,\nsamp {\n  font-family: monospace, monospace;\n  font-size: 1em;\n}\n\n/* Forms\n   ========================================================================== */\n\n/**\n * Known limitation: by default, Chrome and Safari on OS X allow very limited\n * styling of `select`, unless a `border` property is set.\n */\n\n/**\n * 1. Correct color not being inherited.\n *    Known issue: affects color of disabled elements.\n * 2. Correct font properties not being inherited.\n * 3. Address margins set differently in Firefox 4+, Safari 5, and Chrome.\n */\n\nbutton,\ninput,\noptgroup,\nselect,\ntextarea {\n  color: inherit; /* 1 */\n  font: inherit; /* 2 */\n  margin: 0; /* 3 */\n}\n\n/**\n * Address `overflow` set to `hidden` in IE 8/9/10.\n */\n\nbutton {\n  overflow: visible;\n}\n\n/**\n * Address inconsistent `text-transform` inheritance for `button` and `select`.\n * All other form control elements do not inherit `text-transform` values.\n * Correct `button` style inheritance in Firefox, IE 8+, and Opera\n * Correct `select` style inheritance in Firefox.\n */\n\nbutton,\nselect {\n  text-transform: none;\n}\n\n/**\n * 1. Avoid the WebKit bug in Android 4.0.* where (2) destroys native `audio`\n *    and `video` controls.\n * 2. Correct inability to style clickable `input` types in iOS.\n * 3. Improve usability and consistency of cursor style between image-type\n *    `input` and others.\n */\n\nbutton,\nhtml input[type=\"button\"], /* 1 */\ninput[type=\"reset\"],\ninput[type=\"submit\"] {\n  -webkit-appearance: button; /* 2 */\n  cursor: pointer; /* 3 */\n}\n\n/**\n * Re-set default cursor for disabled elements.\n */\n\nbutton[disabled],\nhtml input[disabled] {\n  cursor: default;\n}\n\n/**\n * Remove inner padding and border in Firefox 4+.\n */\n\nbutton::-moz-focus-inner,\ninput::-moz-focus-inner {\n  border: 0;\n  padding: 0;\n}\n\n/**\n * Address Firefox 4+ setting `line-height` on `input` using `!important` in\n * the UA stylesheet.\n */\n\ninput {\n  line-height: normal;\n}\n\n/**\n * It's recommended that you don't attempt to style these elements.\n * Firefox's implementation doesn't respect box-sizing, padding, or width.\n *\n * 1. Address box sizing set to `content-box` in IE 8/9/10.\n * 2. Remove excess padding in IE 8/9/10.\n */\n\ninput[type=\"checkbox\"],\ninput[type=\"radio\"] {\n  box-sizing: border-box; /* 1 */\n  padding: 0; /* 2 */\n}\n\n/**\n * Fix the cursor style for Chrome's increment/decrement buttons. For certain\n * `font-size` values of the `input`, it causes the cursor style of the\n * decrement button to change from `default` to `text`.\n */\n\ninput[type=\"number\"]::-webkit-inner-spin-button,\ninput[type=\"number\"]::-webkit-outer-spin-button {\n  height: auto;\n}\n\n/**\n * 1. Address `appearance` set to `searchfield` in Safari 5 and Chrome.\n * 2. Address `box-sizing` set to `border-box` in Safari 5 and Chrome\n *    (include `-moz` to future-proof).\n */\n\ninput[type=\"search\"] {\n  -webkit-appearance: textfield; /* 1 */\n  -moz-box-sizing: content-box;\n  -webkit-box-sizing: content-box; /* 2 */\n  box-sizing: content-box;\n}\n\n/**\n * Remove inner padding and search cancel button in Safari and Chrome on OS X.\n * Safari (but not Chrome) clips the cancel button when the search input has\n * padding (and `textfield` appearance).\n */\n\ninput[type=\"search\"]::-webkit-search-cancel-button,\ninput[type=\"search\"]::-webkit-search-decoration {\n  -webkit-appearance: none;\n}\n\n/**\n * Define consistent border, margin, and padding.\n */\n\nfieldset {\n  border: 1px solid #c0c0c0;\n  margin: 0 2px;\n  padding: 0.35em 0.625em 0.75em;\n}\n\n/**\n * 1. Correct `color` not being inherited in IE 8/9.\n * 2. Remove padding so people aren't caught out if they zero out fieldsets.\n */\n\nlegend {\n  border: 0; /* 1 */\n  padding: 0; /* 2 */\n}\n\n/**\n * Remove default vertical scrollbar in IE 8/9.\n */\n\ntextarea {\n  overflow: auto;\n}\n\n/**\n * Don't inherit the `font-weight` (applied by a rule above).\n * NOTE: the default cannot safely be changed in Chrome and Safari on OS X.\n */\n\noptgroup {\n  font-weight: bold;\n}\n\n/* Tables\n   ========================================================================== */\n\n/**\n * Remove most spacing between table cells.\n */\n\ntable {\n  border-collapse: collapse;\n  border-spacing: 0;\n}\n\ntd,\nth {\n  padding: 0;\n}\n"
        },
        "$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/fontfamily": {
            "title": "$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/fontfamily",
            "text": "\"Helvetica Neue\", Helvetica, Arial, \"Lucida Grande\", \"DejaVu Sans\", sans-serif"
        },
        "$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/codefontfamily": {
            "title": "$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/codefontfamily",
            "text": "Monaco, Consolas, \"Lucida Console\", \"DejaVu Sans Mono\", monospace"
        },
        "$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/backgroundimageattachment": {
            "title": "$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/backgroundimageattachment",
            "text": "fixed"
        },
        "$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/backgroundimagesize": {
            "title": "$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/backgroundimagesize",
            "text": "auto"

This is [[aaa]]






<<tabs "Welcome [[Graph types]] Intro Use Customize Workings Install Reference Notes ToDo" "Welcome" "$:/temp/about">>







Mother of man.






A biggie.. of course proper titled tiddlers should work.






Like sushi, right?






G'day mate!






[[Source|http://www.mademyday.de/css-height-equals-width-with-pure-css.html]]. Muy interesante; a way to have height resize ''automatically'' from width! I believe it will come in handy at some point.

<div class='box'> 
	<div class='content'>xxx</div> 
</div>

<style>
.box{outline:1px solid red;
	position: relative;
	width: 50px;		/* desired width */
}
.box:before{
	content: "";
	display: block;
	padding-top: 100%; 	/* initial ratio of 1:1*/
}
.content{                          /* this part is only necessary IF there is content */
	position:  absolute;
	top: 0;
	left: 0;
	bottom: 0;
	right: 0;
}
</style>






[[source|https://stackoverflow.com/questions/14208673/how-to-draw-grid-using-html5-and-canvas-or-svg]]

<svg width="100%" height="100%" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    <pattern id="smallGrid" width="8" height="8" patternUnits="userSpaceOnUse">
      <path d="M 8 0 L 0 0 0 8" fill="none" stroke="gray" stroke-width="0.5"/>
    </pattern>
    <pattern id="grid" width="80" height="80" patternUnits="userSpaceOnUse">
      <rect width="80" height="80" fill="url(#smallGrid)"/>
      <path d="M 80 0 L 0 0 0 80" fill="none" stroke="gray" stroke-width="1"/>
    </pattern>
  </defs>

  <rect width="100%" height="100%" fill="url(#grid)" />
</svg>

<img src="https://imgh.us/grid.svg" width="251" height="401"/>






[[bbb]] is here!






\define ydel() <<rpn $(y2)$ $(y)$ ->>
\define xdel() <<rpn $(ydel)$ $(x-step)$ />>

<$vars y2=20 y=10 x-step=10 >
<$wikify name=ydel text=<<ydel>>>
<$set name=xdel value=<<xdel>>>
<div class="myline"></div><<xdel>>
<style>
.myline {
transform:rotate(-<<xdel>>deg);
}
</style>
</$set>
</$wikify>
</$vars>


<style>
.myline {
 width:155px;
xborder-top:1px solid red;
display:block; outline:1px solid blue;
}
</style>

Vitamin [[ccc]]!






*Considering changing the term ''index'' to ''nth'' or ''n'' to harmonize with css.
*Possibly also to encourage moving what is possible from -varstyles into styleblock to use nth-of-type.

\define rotate() <<calc $(index)$ "/$(amount)$">>

\define index-proportion(i) <<calc $i$ "/$(amount)$">>

\define blobs() <div class="ablob ablob$(index)$">$(name)$,$(index)$,<<index-proportion $(index)$>></div>

\define blobs-varstyles()
.$(graph)$ {position:relative;
  margin: 50%;
  transform: translateX(-50%);
  width:0;
} 
.$(item)$ {
  xmargin-top:$(index)$em;
display:inline-block; position:absolute;
xoutline:1px solid red;
padding-left:10vw;
transform:rotate(<<rotate>>turn); transform-origin:  0% 100%;
xline-height:0;
xdirection:rtl;
outline:1px solid yellow;
}
.ablob$(index)$ {position:absolute;
 transform:rotate(-<<rotate>>turn);
outline:1px  solid blue; display:inline; xmargin:0 auto; text-align:center;
cdirection:rtl;
line-height:0;
/* width:5em; */
}
.ablob:before {content:"";
line-height:0;
position:absolute;
border:1px solid red;
	border-radius: 50%;
	width: 100%;
	height: 50px; 
  xmargin: auto 0;
  transform: translate(0%, -50%);
}
\end

<<graph "1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8" blobs>>







0:silver
1:red
2:lightgreen
3:yellow
4:blue
5:crimson
6:magenta
7:indigo
8:turquoise
9:orange
10:silver
11:crimson
12:black






[[source|https://codepen.io/jasonadelia/pen/DnrAe]]

<div class="grid-blacklines">adf
</div>

<style>
.grid-blacklines{
height:255px; width: 555px;
  xheight:100%;
  background-size:50px 50px;
  background-color: transparent;
  background-image:
   linear-gradient(0deg, transparent 24%, rgba(0, 0, 0, .05) 25%, rgba(0, 0, 0, .05) 26%, transparent 27%, transparent 74%, rgba(0, 0, 0, .05) 75%, rgba(0, 0, 0, .05) 76%, transparent 77%, transparent), linear-gradient(90deg, transparent 24%, rgba(0, 0, 0, .05) 25%, rgba(0, 0, 0, .05) 26%, transparent 27%, transparent 74%, rgba(0, 0, 0, .05) 75%, rgba(0, 0, 0, .05) 76%, transparent 77%, transparent);
}
.board-black {
  height: 100%;
  background-color: #434343;
  background-image:linear-gradient(#434343, #282828);
height:255px; width: 555px;
display:block;    
}
.grid-whitelines{
  height:100%;
  background-size:50px 50px;
  background-color: transparent;
  background-image:
   linear-gradient(0deg, transparent 24%, rgba(255, 255, 255, .05) 25%, rgba(255, 255, 255, .05) 26%, transparent 27%, transparent 74%, rgba(255, 255, 255, .05) 75%, rgba(255, 255, 255, .05) 76%, transparent 77%, transparent), linear-gradient(90deg, transparent 24%, rgba(255, 255, 255, .05) 25%, rgba(255, 255, 255, .05) 26%, transparent 27%, transparent 74%, rgba(255, 255, 255, .05) 75%, rgba(255, 255, 255, .05) 76%, transparent 77%, transparent);
}
</style>






.xgrid-blacklines{
  background-size:10% 50px;
  background-color: transparent;
  background-image:
   linear-gradient(0deg, transparent 24%, rgba(0, 0, 0, .05) 25%, rgba(0, 0, 0, .05) 26%, transparent 27%, transparent 74%, rgba(0, 0, 0, .05) 75%, rgba(0, 0, 0, .05) 76%, transparent 77%, transparent), linear-gradient(90deg, transparent 24%, rgba(0, 0, 0, .05) 25%, rgba(0, 0, 0, .05) 26%, transparent 27%, transparent 74%, rgba(0, 0, 0, .05) 75%, rgba(0, 0, 0, .05) 76%, transparent 77%, transparent);
}






<<tabs "[[Optional variants]] [[Completely new graph types]]" "Optional variants">>

A graph type typically consists of two tiddlers - a ''template'' and a ''stylesheet''. 



Basic idea:    
<table style="width:100%">
<tr>
<th></th><th>example</th>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="vertical-align:top; text-align:right;">
''template tiddler''<br><br><br>
//graph item// macro:<br><br>
//style variables// macro:<br>(variable dependent style defs)&nbsp;<br>`.<graphname>-$(index)$` = current item<br>`$(y)$` = current items //y//-field value 
</td>
<td>
__title__: &nbsp;Graph/Mygraph/Macro<br>__tags__: ~$:/tags/Macro<br>
__text__:<br>\define mygraph() $(name)$<br><br>
\define mygraph-varstyles()<br> .mygraph-$(index)$ {<br> &nbsp; margin-bottom:$(y)$px;<br>}<br>\end
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="vertical-align:top; text-align:right;">
''stylesheet tiddler''<br>regular style defs that don't use variables<br><br>`.<graphname>` = whole graph<br><br><br>`.<graphname>-n` = all items<br><br><br>`.<graphname>-2` = item #2 in filter output
</td>
<td>
__title__: Graph/Mygraph/Stylesheet<br>__tags__: ~$:/tags/Stylesheet<br>
__text__:<br>
 .mygraph {<br>&nbsp; position:absolute;<br>&nbsp; max-height:400px;<br>}<br>
 .mygraph-n {<br>&nbsp; border:1px solid red;<br>}<br>
 .mygraph-2 {<br>&nbsp; border:1px solid green;<br>}
</td>
</tr>
</table>

...so calling `<<graph mygraph "I'm tiddlin in the rain">>` would create a graph that is absolutely positioned with a specific max-height. The items would all have a red border, except for item #2 that has a green one. Assuming they have `y` fields with some number, the items woudl be positioned that many pixels up from the bottom.  


...



---

!!Template
A template consists of at least two macros;

*''The "graph item" macro'' - `\define mygraph()`<br>This defines what an single item will //be// in your graph.<br><br>

*''The "style variables" macro'' - `\define mygraph-varstyles()`<br>(Note: exact same title as the graph and a "-varstyles" suffix.)<br>This contains //variable dependent style definitions// for how to display the //graph// and the //items//.

The rest of the styling is put in a...

!!Stylesheet
*The regular ''non-variable dependent'' styling.<br>The //style variables macro// should have as //few// "non-variable dependent" styles as possible because that macro is repeated for each item in the list. So when a style definition does //not// contain a `$(variable)$`, put it in the stylesheet.

!Targeting
In the CSS

|| target |h
|`.mygraph`|The graph|
|`.mygraph-n`|All items simultaneously|
|`.mygraph-3`|The 3d item in the filter output|
|`.mygraph-$(index)$`|The item currently being processed|

If the an ''variant'' argument is used, all the above applies __//plus//__:

|| target |h
|`.foo-mygraph`|The optional variant of the graph|
|`.foo-mygraph-n`|All items simultaneously|
|`.foo-mygraph-3`|The 3d item in the filter output|
|`.foo-mygraph-$(index)$`|The item currently being processed|







You can create variants of templates or new templates. Variants are typically simpler as they only modify an existing template. To understand templates you should probably first understand variants.

<<tabs "[[Variants:Intro]] [[Variants:Making variants]] [[Variants: Notes on variants]] [[Variant vs Template]] Templates" "Variants:Intro"  "$:/temp/customize" "tc-vertical">>








sample content to the [[Graph/Clock/Macro]]






@@.deflist

*graphs
** that should be accessible for the whole graph
*items
** that should be accessible for the items inside the graph<br>- itit 
*items
** that should be accessible for the items inside the graph<br>- itit 

@@


<style>
.deflist {
height:4em;
}
.deflist ul {
  margin-top: -1.3rem;
}
.deflist li  {
list-style-type: none;
float:left;
font-weight:bold; 
outline:1px solid red; 
margin-left:-30px; width:100%;
}
.deflist li > ul > li {
font-weight:normal; border-left:3px solid blue; margin-left:30px; xposition:absolute; width:100%;
}
</style>






\define bars-avg-varstyles()
.bars-avg-1 { bottom:calc(<<avg>> / $(max)$ * 100%); }
.bars-avg-1:before {content:"<<avg>>"; color:red; line-height:1em; font-size:.9em; margin-top:-1.5em; position:absolute;}
\end

<style>
.bars-avg { display:none; }
.bars-avg-1 { display:block; left:0; background:transparent; width:100%; outline:0; border-top:1px dashed crimson; }
.bars-avg-label { display:none; }
</style>

<<getgraph bars>>

<br>So this is "bars". It looked a bit boring so I took the liberty of throwing in a [[variant|Variants]] - an ''average'' line, defined locally in this tiddler.
 
<br><br><br>

<<graph "[tag[sample]]" bars avg>>
<<graph "[tag[sample]]" bars>>
<<graph "[tag[sample]]" y-axis>>
<<graph "[tag[sample]sort[]]" x-axis>>






<<getgraph chronology>>

The olde line o' time...

...but it had to be named //chronolgy// because there is already a timeline macro in TW!

Item distance from bottom is y-value. Branch-length is x value.

Would be interesting to use tiddler //created// date as distance from bottom, to get a timeli.., I mean a chronology, to illustrate //activity//. Maybe use branch length to iindicate diff between //modified// and //created// dates for... some kind of indication...

<<graph "[tag[chronoItem]sort[created]]" chronology >>



If you want a chronology from top to bottom, you add this to the [[Graph/Chronology/Stylesheet]]

```
.graph .graph-chronology { transform:scaleY(-1); }
.chronology { transform:scaleY(-1); }
```

Thanks to //Deus ex Machina//, if an item is missing an x-value it automatically gets one anyway. I have no idea.







\define hbars-acc()
<div  style="left:-$(indent)$; position:absolute; z-index:2">$(index)$. [[$(name)$]]</div>
 sum: $(accsum)$
\end

\define hbars-acc-varstyles()
.graph .hbars-acc-$(index)$ { width:calc($(accshare)$ * 1%); }
\end

\define hbars-demo-varstyles()
.graph .hbars-demo-$(index)$ { width:$(y-of-total)$%; }
\end

<style>
.graph-hbars-demo { position:relative;}
.hbars-acc { background:yellow; line-height:1rem; }
.hbars-demo { line-height:1rem; }
</style>

<<getgraph hbars>>

To get a horizontal bar graph, simply do:

 `<<graph "[tag[sample]sort[]]" hbars>>`

...to get standard bars with lengths relative to y-value up to full tiddler width.

//Yaaawn!// - Let's make it more interesting.

The @@background:yellow;yellow@@  bars is a [[variant|Variants]] where each item shows the accumulated sum.... or, rather, the accumulated //share//, accumulating up to 100, which is used as % of tiddler width. And the @@background:pink;pink@@ bars, also a variant, are relative to the total sum (which logically is the same as the full accumulation).

<br>

<<graph "[tag[sample]sort[]]" hbars acc>>
<<graph "[tag[sample]sort[]]" hbars demo>>

<br>

```
<<graph "[tag[sample]sort[]]" hbars acc>>
<<graph "[tag[sample]sort[]]" hbars demo>>
```

Graphs float and overlap by default (`position:absolute`) so I made the bottom graph `position:relative;` to make it occupy space and push down this text.


!!!The name list and the graph indentation
The name list //could// have been a separate graph (e.g a [[simplelist|Graph/Simplelist/Macro]]) ...and the whole display //could// have been put in a table to get the hbars to be indented etc.

''The name list'' to the left of a bars is simply part of the item for one of the variants. 

''Indenting a graph'' seemed like a common enough use case to warrant a simple UI. So, the core takes any [[indent field|Special fields]] value in the display tiddler and indents the graph. In our case here, we use:

```
hbars-acc-indent:  10em
hbars-demo-indent: 10em
```

Nothing further needed.

...

...but ''how prevent the name list from indenting''? Or how move it back left?

Solve it anyway you want. One idea is to //not// use the default //indent// field on all items but only on the bar parts (in our case here, the "sum:..."). I instead did this in the variant items definition for (only) the name part:

```
<div style="left:-$(indent)$; position:absolute; z-index:2">
  $(index)$. [[$(name)$]]
</div>
```

Works perfect - just not an elegant solution. That `$(indent)$` is predefined to fetch the value in the [[indent fields|Special fields]] mentioned previously.

Is a special class warranted? I dislike special magic classes etc that the user must learn. Adding fields (i.e //indent//) is already special, and introducing special //classes// too... hmm... not sure. What say you?






<<getgraph likert>>

Do you [[like..rt scales|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Likert_scale]]?

<br>

<<graph "Hate'em They're&nbsp;OK OMG!!!" likert first>>

...as achieved with:
<center>

`<<graph``"Hate'em They're&nbsp;OK OMG!!!"``likert>>`

</center>
<br>
You might note the "tiddler list" is here just a list of words. This is OK because no values are needed for this "graph", other than those "titles". Also note the use of `&nbsp;` for blank spaces inside the words.

''Checking a box'' sets, in the [[display tiddler]], the `likert(-variant)` ''field''. I.e if you use a [[variant|Variants]], which you should if there are several likert scales in the same tiddler, you might for example get this ''field : value''...

`status-firstquestion : They're&nbsp;OK`

!!!Questionnaires

The likert axis is styled to //cover the top border in a table cell//, so you can put it together with a corresponding label or a question in an unstyled table, and they appear to be in one cell. Of course, a likert scale is a single line so you might not want a table... but anyway:
<br><br>

|Do you likert?<br><br>|
|<<graph """Hate'em They're&nbsp;OK OMG!!!""" likert first>>|
|Should likert scales be in tables?<br><br>|
|<<graph "Never Occasionally On&nbsp;Tuesdays Always" likert second>>|
|Are you tired of non-sensical answers?<br><br>|
|<<graph "[tag[sample]]" likert third>>|

...as achieved via...

```
|Do you likert?<br><br>|
|<<graph """Hate'em They're&nbsp;OK OMG!!!""" likert first>>|
|Should likert scales be in tables?<br><br>|
|<<graph "Never Occasionally On&nbsp;Tuesdays Always" likert second>>|
|Are you tired of non-sensical answers?<br><br>|
|<<graph "[tag[sample]]" likert third>>|
```

...but, of course, considering how the likert scale is a single line, the use of a table might not bring any value.






<<getgraph line>>

<br>An "item" in a line graph is an svg line between y and the next y. These items are then spread out evenly in x-direction.

Note: you may also be interested in the (yet unfinished) [[Graph/Polyline/Macro]]

The plotted values is `y` but the items are sorted by the `x` value. Could be sorted by anything of course.
<br><br>

|graphtable|k
|<<graph "[tag[sample]nsort[x]]" y-axis >>|<<graph "[tag[sample]nsort[x]]" line >>|
||<<graph "[tag[sample]nsort[x]]" x-axis>>|

I put this one in a [[graphtable|Graphs in tables]]

```
|graphtable|k
|<<graph "[tag[sample]nsort[x]]" y-axis >>|<<graph "[tag[sample]nsort[x]]" line >>|
||<<graph "[tag[sample]nsort[x]]" x-axis>>|
```

For a quickie, it could be done without a table but the y-axis comes out in the gutter then:

```
<<graph "[tag[sample]nsort[x]]" y-axis >>
<<graph "[tag[sample]nsort[x]]" line >>
<<graph "[tag[sample]nsort[x]]" x-axis >>
```







<<getgraph mapper>>

<br>Mapper is a kind of combo between the [[scatter|Demo Scatter]] and the [[prettylist|Demo Prettylist]] graphs. Its item consists of two "parts" - the name and location mark where the latter is positioned at x,y-coordinates.

You could feed a TW with an excel sheet of locations and coordinates and have them map out automatically.

@@color:crimson; ''Note''! Mappings can be on //anything// - anatomy charts, guest seating for a wedding dinner...@@ And if you're geographically disabled, //already this demo can be of value!!!//

<br>

<<graph "[tag[continent]]" mapper worldmap >>

<div style="float:right;padding-right:1em;">(hover the markers)</div>

<br>

` <<graph "[tag[continent]]" mapper worldmap>>`

[[worldmap]] is a potential(!) variant but more crucially in mapper graphs, it is ''also'' the name of a tiddler, an image tiddler! This exemplifies a technique not used in the other graphs, i.e to use data from a separate tiddler as part of the graph.

Currently, mapper does not work with [[external images|http://tiddlywiki.com/#ExternalImages]].

!!!Default
Skipping the variant name, gives you a 10x10 grid background.

<center>` <<graph "[tag[continent]]" mapper>>`</center>

<br>


  <<graph "[tag[continent]]" mapper >>

<br>






<style>
.graph-pie-demo    { left:10%; }

/* Serving slice four */
.pie-demo-4   { margin-left:-15vw; }
.pie-demo-label-4     { display:none; }
.pie-demo-4:before  { content:"For you ! ;-)"; left:3.2em; top:-1em; white-space:nowrap;}

/* Some label tweaks */
.pie-demo-label-1  { margin-top:-1em; }
.pie-demo-label-2  { margin-top:2em; }
.pie-demo-label-5  { margin-top:-1em; }
.pie-demo-label-8  { margin-right:-45%; }
</style>

<<getgraph pie>>

<br>After much research for a CSS pie, I found [[this|https://www.codeseek.co/AtomicNoggin/01---pure-css-pie-charts-revisited-fEish]] CSS solution. Then started the //really// hard work... //Oy vey!// - I should listen more carefully to [[Carl Sagan|https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7s664NsLeFM]]. I barely pulled this one off.  <br>

Basically, a pie chart is a //stack// with several pies. Each with only a visible ''slice'' and turned into position.

<br>

<<graph "[tag[sample]!nsort[y]!y[0]]" pie demo>>
<!-- I added !y[0]  to avoid labels for items with y-value 0 -->
<br>

!!Variants
Take a peek in this tiddlers edit to see an example of a pie [[variant|Variants]], here named demo.

Note that ''each slice is really a full pie''. So target a slice with `.pie-yummy-5`

!!Pie-diameter field
Default diameter is same as global default graph height. You can control the diameter locally in the source tiddler, i.e the tiddler where you're displaying - or transcluding(!) -the pie, in a field like so

`pie-diameter : 20vh` or, if several pies in one tiddler; `pie-myvariant1-diameter : 20vh` etc.

Use any CSS length unit.

!!Pie-labels
The labels are tricky to //position// because they turn with the slices, may vary in length, etc. (I'm talking about the real labels, not the "For you" joke above... even if you may find the method for that interesting too)

You can do it like this, but it takes tweaking. 

```
.pie-blueberry-label {
  right:75%;
  top:-20%; 
}
```

Or maybe you want to... 

!!!...turn off labels

:in variant: `.pie-tasty-label { display:none }`
:or globally via the [[Graph/Pie/Stylesheet]]: `.pie-label { display:none }`<br>...and perhaps turn them //on// locally `.pie-demo-label {display:block}`

...maybe use a [[prettylist|Demo Prettylist]] instead?

!!!More labels than slices - huh??? 
Items with value 0 also add labels but (of course) no visible slice. To prevent this, add `!y[0]` in the filter.







<<getgraph prettylist>>

<br>Just a purdy list. Suitable to use with e.g [[pie charts|Demo Pie]] because the colours match automatically.

<div>
<div class="demopretty">

Each item shows...

- a ''label'' to refer to something in the graph,<br>&nbsp;&nbsp; number-wise or color-wise (from [[colors]])<br>
- the ''tiddler title''<br>
- and the ''y-value''
</div>

<div class="demopretty demoprettylist">
<<graph "[tag[sample]]" prettylist>>
<br>
</div>

<div style="clear: both;"></div>
</div>

<br><br><br>

The position on the right? - I could have made a [[variant|Variants]]-style or used the [[indent field|Special fields]] but for this demo I just put in a few divs to float the text and the prettylist.

<style>
.demopretty {
  float:left;
  max-width:50%;
}
.demoprettylist {
  padding-left:2em;
}
</style>






<<getgraph rating>>

<br>Now that //Amazon.com// is switching over 100% to TiddlyWiki, Bezzy (yeah, I call him that) begged me to implement the rating system for a 25% share of the company. I told him I should publish it here for you guys first - so here it is:


<br>
<<graph "[tag[rated]!sort[y]]" rating star >>

<br>
`<<graph "[tag[rated]!sort[y]]" rating star >>`

The solution is pretty close to [[hBars|Demo hBars (horizontal bars)]]. Y-value is number of stars. 

Like in [[mapper|Demo Mapper]], the `star` argument isn't a variant (but it  //can// be!). Instead it is here used to specify the ''name of the image tiddler'' -  [[star]]. This tiddler also contains a field named //scale// which tells how big the image should appear (in the rem unit). In this case the scale is 2.

If you want the titles to be same font size as the stars, in the varstyles throw in:<br>  `font-size: {{$(variant)$!!scale}}rem;`.

Contrary to most other graphs, the display ''does not adjust dynamically'' to tiddler width! This is because it would distort the stars.

...

''The original idea'' was to make an unlimited row of stars in the background and have them be //revealed// by the rating value. This is a pretty cool idea and would allow to show e.g 4.3 stars... and perhaps even [[overlaid]] on empty uncoloured ("unachieved") stars. Turned out tricky with the expansion aspect again. If you have a good solution, please shout out.







<style>
.graph-scatter-demo {
 height:150px;
 max-width:90%;
 position:relative;
}
.scatter-demo-4 { border:2px dashed orange;
}
.graph .graph-scatter .scatter-demo-6:hover:after {
 content:"This one (dot1) has no content to transclude";
}
.fake-axes {
 border-left:      1px solid silver;
 border-bottom:1px solid silver; 
 margin: 2em 0;
}
</style>

<<getgraph scatter>>

<br>Transcluded tiddler content at arbitrary x,y coordinates!

Hover item for coordinates.

<br>

<div class="fake-axes">
 <<graph "[tag[scatteritem]!sort[]]" scatter demo>>
</div>

*Item positions are specified in the respective tiddlers `x` and `y` fields.
*An idea is  to make the whole item be a link to the tiddler.
*[[Here|https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3680429/click-through-a-div-to-underlying-elements?rq=1]]'s a technique to click //through// a div to access an underlying element. Imagine e.g a map and positioned links under it. Or see [[mapper|Demo Mapper]].

!!!Tweaks for this particular example
```
<div class="fake-axes">
 <<graph "[tag[scatteritem]]" scatter demo>>
</div>

```

The axes in this example are fake;  simple borders on a surrounding div. Of course, you can use real axes. But note that the Scatter graph positions its items per coordinate, whereas most axes spreads their items evenly! Risk for mismatch! The special built-in variant `x-axis-accsum` was made for this, see [[Demo x-axis]].

The [[variant|Variants]] parameter  - named `demo` -  lets me deviate from the standard scatter template. Here I use it in a local styleblock in this tiddler (take a peek). It could have been in a separate stylesheet or included (at bottom) in the scatter stylesheet.

The definitions are named `.scatter-demo...`:

```
.graph-scatter-demo {
 position:relative; /* so not floating */
 max-width:90%; /* so rightmost items don't bleed over tid edge */
}
.scatter-demo-4 {
  outline:2px dashed orange;
}
.graph .graph-scatter .scatter-demo-6:hover:after {
 content:"This one (dot1) has no content to transclude";
}
```
That last bit is [[css-specific|https://css-tricks.com/specifics-on-css-specificity/]] in order to overwrite the [[Graph/Scatter/Macro]] definition for the hover:after content.







\define x-axis-funny() <$link to="$(name)$">{{$(name)$!!caption}}</$link>

\define x-axis-funny-varstyles()
.x-axis-funny-$(index)$ a {
 color:{{colors##$(index)$}};
}
\end

<style>
.graph-x-axis-funny  { border-top:2px solid lightgreen; }
.x-axis-funny  { font-family:"Comic Sans MS"; }
</style>

<<getgraph x-axis>>

<br>This is the x-axis. 

Here's the standard `<<graph "[tag[sample]sort[]]" x-axis>>` showing the tiddler titles

<br>

<<graph "[tag[sample]sort[]]" x-axis>>

<br>

Here's a funnier [[variant|Variants]] called with:<br>
`<<graph "[tag[sample]sort[]]" x-axis funny>>`

<br>

<<graph "[tag[sample]sort[]]" x-axis funny>>

<br>

This funny variant is defined locally in this tiddler. Note that it redefines //both// the item shown and the styling. The item is here the tiddlers //caption field// instead of the tiddler title, and uses another index-based styling.

!!!!Experimental
The following one uses a predefined [[variant|Variants]] (defined in the [[x-axis macro|Graph/x-axis/Macro]]). I'm hesitant to introduce variants as part of the templates because variants are intended as a means for end user modifications. Still I didn't want to create a full template for this:<br>
`<<graph "[tag[sample]sort[]]" x-axis accsum>>`

<br>

<<graph "[tag[sample]sort[]]" x-axis accsum>>

<br>
The variant could be named anything but I thought "accsum" was appropriate as it indicates what it is about. So, it shows the items accumulated y-values at their //relative// position. The rightmost //total// is separately added. [[Gantt|Demo Gantt]] is an example use case. 







<<getgraph y-axis>>

The y-axis is designed to:

*count down from y max to zero
*...in as many steps as there are items

Example: `<<graph "[tag[smallsample]]" y-axis>>`

<br>

<div style="float:right; width:80%; margin:0 0 0 0em; xoutline:1px solid red">

"''Even 10's''" would be nice but at the moment this is not implemented.

''Gutter position'' - why? "Main graphs" (e.g bars) are set to spread maximally (i.e 100% of tiddler width). And a graph can't know that it is next to some other graph (in this case the y-axis) so they'd overlap or one ends up below the other. (If you can come up with a good floating solution please tell! )

So, I put the y-axis in the gutter, which is hard coded in TW as width:42px. But ''for small screens'' where the gutter is width:0 or just for aesthetics you can...

</div>

<br>

<<graph "[tag[smallsample]]" y-axis>>

<br><br>

''Use a table'' to put the y-axis in normal position:
<br><br>

<div style="float:right; position:absolute; width:30vw; margin-left: 10vw; xoutline:1px solid red">

```
|graphtable|k
|<<graph "[tag[smallsample]]" y-axis>>| (main graph) |
```
"graphtable" is a [[predefined|Graph/_Core/Stylesheet]] class and "k" is [[standard TW|http://tiddlywiki.com/#Tables%20in%20WikiText]] to apply it. It removes the table borders and a few more tweaks.

</div>


|graphtable|k
|<<graph "[tag[smallsample]]" y-axis>>|


!!Height 
<br>

|graphtable|k
|<<graph "[tag[smallsample]]" y-axis myheight>>| Height is easily restyled with a [[variant|Variants]] like so<br><br>`.graph-y-axis-myheight {`<br>` height:200px; }`<br><br>Just make sure your main graph(-s) have the same height ...<br><br>Default height (for all graphs) comes from [[Graph/_Core/Stylesheet]] |

<style>
.graph-y-axis-myheight {height:130px;}
</style>









{{discovery}}






Quite a few discoveries have been made in the dev process. At least discoveries for //me//:

<$list filter="[tag[discovery]]">

*<$link to={{!!title}}>{{!!title}}</$link>
**<$transclude mode=block/>
</$list>

<style>
ul > li > ul > li > p {margin:0}
</style>


*The idea with a "core macro" to extensively create variables `$(...)$` for a larger environment of independent macros and tiddlers
*Using recursion for indexing elements in a list  
*Vendor [[Graph/_CoreComp/vendors]]
*The "variant" argument concept that extends an existing macros functionality.
*Use the [[qualify]] macro to give an ID for things in CSS, for [[Specificity]]. Small text case can be found here <<tag specificity-test>> 

Minor

*CSS counters; as used in the [[y-axis|Demo y-axis]]... counting between specific nrs, with specifc step, in reverse, and physically spread out evenly and more...

Ideas/opinions:

*"Recursion" should be a widget. I'm guessing it basically is; the listwidget... so maybe it just needs to be extended to allow for indexing of the list items....













this is [[dot2]] with some more content







this is [[dot3]]







this is [[dot4]]







this is [[dot5]]







this is [[dot6]]







Sweden. Anything more?
















































Example of graphs stacked in wrong order, i.e not main-x-y

```
<<graph "[tag[sample]nsort[x]]" x-axis >>
<<graph "[tag[sample]nsort[x]]" y-axis>>
<<graph "[tag[sample]nsort[x]]" line >>
```

<br><br>
<<graph "[tag[sample]nsort[x]]" x-axis >>
<<graph "[tag[sample]nsort[x]]" y-axis>>
<<graph "[tag[sample]nsort[x]]" line >>







The [[Graph/_Core]] is littered with mini-macros for various variable calculations. These should be separate macro tiddlers and more generalized.

This would also make a nice base for a TW "math" library. For example, I made [[Graph/_supp/Abs]].






\define foo(val1, val2) $($val1$)$ $($val2$)$

<$set name=a value=Hey >
<$set name=b value=you >
<<foo a b >>
</$set>
</$set>

```
\define foo(val1, val2) $($val1$)$ $($val2$)$

<$set name=a value=Hey >
<$set name=b value=you >
<<foo a b >>
</$set>
</$set>
```

Note the pretty macro-call `<<foo a b>>`. 

IF foo had been defined as `$val1$ $val2$`, you could not call it like that but would have to use `<$macrocall $name=foo val1=<<a>> val2=<<b>> />` i.e to evaluate a and b before foo is used.

IF foo had been defined as `$(a)$ $(b)$` then you can call it with (only) `<<foo>>` - BUT it would not be generic so you'd be forced to use only "a" and "b" as variable names.

The above form is generic and allows re-use of the foo macro for any variables.

```
<$set name=a value=Hey >
<$set name=b value=you>
<$set name=c value=there >
<<foo a b >>! Yeah, <<foo b c>>! <<foo a c>>.
</$set>
</$set>
</$set>
```

<$set name=a value=Hey >
<$set name=b value=you>
<$set name=c value=there >
<<foo a b >>! Yeah, <<foo b c>>! <<foo a c>>.
</$set>
</$set>
</$set>

...or, when the circumstances allow, even:


```
<$vars a=Hey b=you c=there >
<<foo a b >>! Yeah, <<foo b c>>! <<foo a c>>.
</$vars>
```

<$vars a=Hey b=you c=there >
<<foo a b >>! Yeah, <<foo b c>>! <<foo a c>>.
</$vars>








<$wikify name=x text=20 >
<$wikify name=y text=30 >
<div class="mybox">
<div class="myline">
</div>
</div>
<style>
.mybox {
  height:<<y>>px;
}
.myline {
  height:<<y>>px;
  width:<<x>>%;
}
</style>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>

<style>
.mybox {position:relative; xoverflow:hidden; outline:1px solid yellow;
}
.myline {outline:1px solid red;
  position:absolute; bottom:0;
    background:
       linear-gradient(to top left,
           rgba(0,0,0,0) 0%,
           rgba(0,0,0,0) calc(50% - 0.8px),
           rgba(0,0,0,1) 50%,
           rgba(0,0,0,0) calc(50% + 0.8px),
           rgba(0,0,0,0) 100%)
}
</style>






!!How tall should a graph be?
What does "y = 230" mean on the screen? Or "y = .003" ?

Whereas there is a natural default //width// for a graph - the tiddler width - there is no obvious default height.

Currently, most graphs use the y value for //pixels//, e.g 230px from bottom... but that is problematic with big or small numbers.

I will likely implement a global default height for templates to be e.g 50vh, i.e 50% of viewport height. The assumption is that if there is a graph in a tiddler, you want to see it in full but also the tiddler title etc.

Also, note that not all graphs have a height - for example pies, various x-axes and horizontal graphs (e.g [[hBars|Demo hBars (horizontal bars)]]).

As always, it would be easy to redefine a height with a [[variant|Variants]] or just a template stylesheet.







Idea: Maybe a graph should always be a coordinate system, and one places out not only the items but also the axes at x/y coordinates. I.e they be items too...






!!!Graph types
...a.k.a //templates// currently include: 

<$list filter="[tag[demo]sort[]]" variable=demo>
<$list filter="[<demo>removeprefix[Demo]]" variable=name>
&nbsp;&nbsp;-  <$link to=<<demo>>><<name>></$link><br>
</$list>
</$list>

...and more are planned, or at least "intended": <$list filter="[tag[under_development]!tag[$:/tags/Stylesheet]sort[]]">
<$link to={{!!title}}>{{!!caption}}</$link>, 
</$list> (do help out! ;-)







\define x,y()  <<rpn $(x)$ $(x-scale)$ * >>,<<rpn $(y)$ $(y-scale)$ *>>
\define attempt-to-get-relative-value-x,y()  $(x-of-max)$,$(y-of-total)$

\define polyline-svg()
<svg class="polyline-svg"
         viewBox="$(xmin)$ $(ymin)$ $(xmax)$ $(ymax)$"
         preserveAspectRatio="none"
>
  <polyline
     vector-effect:non-scaling-stroke;
     fill="none"
     stroke="red"
     stroke-width="3"
     stroke-linecap="round"
     points="$(coords)$"
  />
</svg>
\end

\define scale-ymax() <<rpn $(ymax)$ $(y-scale)$ *>>
\define scale-xmax() <<rpn $(xmax)$ $(x-scale)$ *>>
\define scale-ymin() <<rpn $(ymin)$ $(y-scale)$ *>>
\define scale-xmin() <<rpn $(xmin)$ $(x-scale)$ *>>

\define calc-t(a, b)  <<rpn $a$ $b$ *>>

\define scale-t(direction, firstlast)
<$set name=$direction$$firstlast$
          value={{{ $(list)$ +[get[$direction$]!nsort[]$firstlast$[]] }}}>
 <<rpn $(xmin)$ $(x-scale)$ *>>
</$set>
\end

\define graph-polyline(list, x-scale:"1", y-scale:"1")
<$vars x-scale=$x-scale$ y-scale=$y-scale$>
<$set name=ymax value={{{ $list$ +[get[y]!nsort[]first[]] }}}>
<$set name=xmax value={{{ $list$ +[get[x]!nsort[]first[]] }}}>
<$set name=ymin value={{{ $list$ +[get[y]nsort[]first[]] }}}>
<$set name=xmin value={{{ $list$ +[get[x]nsort[]first[]] }}}>
<$wikify name=t text=<<scale-t "$list$">> >
<$wikify name=ymax text=<<scale-ymax>> >
<$wikify name=xmax text=<<scale-xmax>> >
<$wikify name=ymin text=<<scale-ymin>> >
<$wikify name=xmin text=<<scale-xmin>> >
<$wikify name=coords text=<<graph "$list$" "x,y" >>>
<<ymax>>
<<polyline-svg>>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$set>
</$set>
</$set>
</$set>
</$vars>
\end

<style>
.polyline-svg {
  transform: scale(1,-1);
  width:100%;
  outline: 1px solid blue;
}
</style>

FOR A GRAPH TEMPLATE, SEE [[Graph/Polyline/Macro]]

@@color:crimson; This here ''not'' a //Graph// template@@ like the other graphs! See comments below. 

|!Under development|

SVG polyline draws lines between all points in a coordinate list.

`<<graph-polyline '[tag[scatteritem]]'>>`

<<graph-polyline '[tag[scatteritem]]' 4 2 >>

SVG ''polyline'' draws lines between all points in a coordinates list.

In contrast, an SVG (single-) //line// draws between only two coordinates. That is what is used in the [[line|Demo Line]] graph template, because the //graph// macro gets a list as input and then applies such an svg line //for each item//(-pair) in the list.

However, the //graph// macro can of course not apply a //polyline// to each item in its list. So the ''graph core'cannot use the SVG polyline''.

However, the //graph// macro is of use //inside// the SVG polyline to assemble that //coordinates list// that the polyline needs. 

So this is all put in a macro I named ''graph-polyline'' to be used like so

`<<graph-polyline '[tag[scatteritem]]'>>`

---
[the following is not yet mplemented and I possibly misunderstand SVG viewboxes so I'm not sure this is appropriate]

Further, the graph macro is used to scale the coordinates so the displayed polyline maximizes in the tiddler. SVG otherwise takes each coordinate to be a //pixel// position, which makes the display static and does not expand when you change tiddler width.






\define lineheight() {{$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/metrics/lineheight}}

\define graph-field(field) {{$(sourcetid)$!!$(template)$$(-variant)$-$field$}}

\define graph-accessory(field) 
<div class="graph-$field$ $(template)$-$field$ $(template)$$(-variant)$-$field$">
  <<graph-field $field$>>
</div>
\end

\define =(a, hundred, b, op:"/", dec) <<rpn "$($a$)$$hundred$" "$($b$)$" "$op$" "$dec$">>

\define calc-x-step() <<rpn 100 $(amount)$ / >>

\define calc-total(valuefield:"y") <<totalsum """$(list)$""" $valuefield$ >>

\define calc-accsum() <<totalsum """$(accumulated)$""" y>>

\define accsum0() <<rpn $(accsum)$ $(y)$ - >>

\define calc-accshare() <$macrocall $name=rpn a=<<rpn $(accsum)$ 100 *>> b=$(total)$ operation="/" />

\define accshare0() <<rpn $(accshare)$ $(y-of-total)$ - >>

\define theitem()
<div class="$(tid)$ $(template)$ $(variant)$ $(template)$-$(index)$
                   $(template)$$(-variant)$ $(template)$$(-variant)$-$(index)$">
   <$set name=template-to-use
             filter=<<$(template)$$(-variant)$>>
             value=<<$(template)$$(-variant)$>>
             emptyValue=<<$(template)$>>
   >
      <<template-to-use>>
   </$set>
</div>
<style>
   <<$(template)$-varstyles>>
   <<$(template)$$(-variant)$-varstyles>>
</style>
\end

\define itm() item

\define items(currentlist, accumulated)
<$set      name=name             value={{{ $currentlist$ +[first[]] }}} >
<$set      name=index0            value={{{ [enlist<accumulated>count[]] }}} >
<$set      name=accumulated  filter="[enlist[$accumulated$]] [<name>]" >
<$wikify  name=index              text={{{ [enlist<accumulated>count[]] }}} >
<$wikify  name=-index             text={{{ [<index>] +[addprefix[-]] }}} >
<$set name=item    filter=" $(variant)$"
                                  value="$(tid)$.$(template)$-$(variant)$<<-index>>" 
                                  emptyValue="$(tid)$.$(template)$<<-index>>" >
<$wikify  name=acclist             text="{{{ [enlist[$accumulated$]] [<name>]}}}" >
<$wikify  name=y                     text={{{ $currentlist$ +[nth[1]get[y]] }}} >
<$set      name=x                     filter={{{ $currentlist$ +[nth[1]get[x]] }}}
                                                                emptyValue="""<<= x-step "" index *>>""" >
<$wikify  name=x                     text=<<x>>>
<$wikify  name=y2                   text={{{ $currentlist$ +[nth[2]get[y]] }}} >
<$wikify  name=x2                   text={{{ $currentlist$ +[nth[2]get[x]] }}} >
<$wikify  name=accsum          text="<<calc-accsum>>" >
<$wikify  name=accshare        text=<<calc-accshare>> >
<$wikify  name=y-of-total         text="<<= y 00 total>>" >
<$wikify  name=y-of-max         text="<<= y 00 max>>" >
<$wikify  name=x-of-max         text="<<= x 00 x-max>>" >
<$set name=responsivelength value=<<csscalc>>>
  <<theitem>>
</$set>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$set>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$set>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
  <$set name="rest" filter="$currentlist$ +[rest[]]">
    <$list filter="[enlist<rest>first[]]">
      <$macrocall $name=items
               currentlist=<<rest>> accumulated=<<accumulated>> template="$template$" />
    </$list>
  </$set>
</$set>
</$set>
</$set>
\end

\define thegraph()
<$set name=graph filter=" $(variant)$"
                                 value="$(tid)$.graph-$(template)$-$(variant)$" 
                                 emptyValue="$(tid)$.graph-$(template)$" >
<div class="graph" >
   <div class="graph-inner graph-$(template)$ graph-$(template)$$(-variant)$ $(tid)$">
      <<graph-accessory header>>
      <<items "$(list)$">>
      <<graph-accessory footer>>
   </div>
</div>
<style>
.<<graph>> {
  max-width:calc(100% - $(indent)$);
  margin-left:$(indent)$;
}
</style>
</$set>
\end

\define graph(list, template, variant)
<$wikify name=sourcetid         text={{!!title}} >
<$wikify name=template          text="$template$" >
<$wikify name=tid                    text="tid<<qualify>>" >
<$wikify name=variant             text="$variant$" >
<$set     name=-variant            filter=" $variant$" value="-$variant$" emptyValue="" >
<$set     name=.variant            filter=" $variant$" value=".$variant$" emptyValue="" >
<$wikify name=defaultheight   text={{Graph/_Core/Stylesheet!!defaultheight}} >
<$set     name=list                   filter="""$list$""" >
<$wikify name=total                 text=<<calc-total>> >
<$wikify name=x-total              text=<<calc-total x>> >
<$wikify name=amount            text={{{ $list$ +[count[]] }}} >
<$wikify name=amount-           text={{{ $list$ +[rest[]count[]] }}} >
<$set     name=max                 value={{{ $list$  +[get[y]] +[nsort[]last[]] }}} >
<$set     name=min                  value={{{ $list$  +[get[y]] +[nsort[]first[]] }}} >
<$set     name=x-max              value={{{ $list$  +[get[x]] +[nsort[]last[]] }}} >
<$wikify name=x-step              text=<<calc-x-step>> >
<$wikify name=indent              text=<<graph-field indent>> >
<$wikify name=lineheight         text=<<lineheight>> >
  <<thegraph>>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$set>
</$set>
</$set>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$set>
</$wikify>
</$set>
</$set>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
\end

\define csscalc(value:"y") calc($($value$)$ / $(total)$ * 100%)






<pre>.graph {
  position:relative;
}
.graph-inner {
  position:absolute;
  width:100%;
  height:{{Graph/_Core/Stylesheet!!defaultheight}};  /* default height for most graphs */
  display:flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  justify-content: space-between;
}
p > .graph {   /* remove margin added by p (!?) */
  margin-bottom:-1em;
}
/* Header and footer */
.graph-header {
  position:absolute;
  margin-top:-2em;
  width:100%;
  text-align:center;
  font-size:1.5rem;
}
.graph-footer {
  position:absolute;
  bottom:0;
  margin-bottom:-2rem;
  width:100%;
  text-align:center;
}
.graph-accessory { position:absolute;
}
td .graph-inner {
  position:relative;
  display:table-cell;
  width:100vw;
}
/* Graphs in tables */
.graphtable { width:100%;
}
.graphtable, .graphtable tr, .graphtable td {  border:0;  padding:0;
}
.graphtable td {
  /* width:0px;  prevent table cells from autowidening */
  vertical-align:bottom;
}
/* experimental
.xgraphtable td:nth-child(2) {
  width:100%;
}
*/
</pre>






\define avg(dec:"1")  <<rpn $(total)$ $(amount)$ / $dec$>>







\define elementlabels(content, bottom:"1em")
/******
   Common style defs for labels in graphs.
   When called, in a template, this is already surrounded by "style" html tags.
   Note units.
*******/
  background:lightgreen;
  padding:5px;
  content:"$content$";
  position:absolute;
  bottom:$bottom$;
  z-index:2;
  border-radius:.9rem;
  text-align:center;
  min-width:1rem; height:1rem;
  display:inline-block;
  line-height:1rem;
  border:1px solid; 
\end







\define accumulate() <<rpn $(value)$ $(tempsum)$ +>>

\define totalsum(list, valuefield:"title", tempsum:"0")
<$wikify name=tempsum text=$tempsum$ >
<$list filter="$list$ +[first[]]" >
   <$set name=value filter={{!!$valuefield$}} emptyValue="0">
   <$wikify name=value text=<<value>>>
      <$set name=rest filter="$list$ +[rest[]]" >
          <$macrocall $name=totalsum list=<<rest>> 
              valuefield="$valuefield$" tempsum=<<accumulate>>
           />
      </$set>
   </$wikify>
   </$set>
</$list>
<$list filter="$list$ +[count[]prefix[0]]">$tempsum$</$list>
</$wikify>
\end






\define vendors(prop, arg1, arg2)
  -moz-transform$prop$:$arg1$ $arg2$;
  -ms-transform$prop$:$arg1$ $arg2$;
  -webkit-transform$prop$:$arg1$ $arg2$;
  -o-transform$prop$:$arg1$ $arg2$;
  transform:$arg1$ $arg2$;
\end






0:bold 60px/1 "Verdana", sans-serif
1:100px/1 Impact, Helvetica Narrow, sans-serif
2:italic 40px/1 "Georgia", serif
3:40px/1 "Verdana", sans-serif
4:bold 40px/1 Courier New, Courier, monospace
5:bold 100px/1 "Verdana", sans-serif
6:bold 25px/1 "Verdana", sans-serif
7:italic 80px/1 "Verdana", sans-serif
8:italic 20px/1 "Verdana", sans-serif
9:italic 20px/1 "Verdana", sans-serif







\define chaosposition(class, spread)
.$class$ { /*up right*/
 margin: $spread$% -$spread$vw 0em 0em;
}
.x$class$:nth-of-type(2n+1) {
 margin: -$spread$% $spread$% 0 0 ;
}
.x$class$:nth-of-type(3n+2) {
  margin: 0;
}
.x$class$:nth-child(5n+3) {
 margin: 0 -$spread$% 0 $spread$%;
}
\end

#p1  {text-align: right;  margin: -185px 0 85px 0}    /* top right */
#p2  {text-align: left;   margin: -190px 0 150px 5%}  /* top left */
#p3  {text-align: right;  margin: -90px 35% 50px 0}   /* center */
#p4  {text-align: right;  margin: -95px 0 55px 0}     /* center right */
#p5  {text-align: left;   margin: -130px 0 30px 0}    /* center left */
#p6  {text-align: left;   margin: -40px 0 15px 35%}   /* bottom center */
#p7  {text-align: right;  margin: -80px 0 0px 0}      /* bottom right */
#p8  {text-align: left;   margin: -40px 0 20px 3%}    /* bottom left */
#p9  {text-align: right;  margin: -25px 0 5px 0}      /* bottom right */
#p10 {text-align: left;   margin: -130px 0 70px 0}    /* center left */






\define chaosturn(class, turn)
.$class$                              { transform: rotate($turn$turn); }
.$class$:nth-of-type(2n+1) { transform: rotate(-$turn$turn); }
.$class$:nth-of-type(3n+2) { transform: none; }
.$class$:nth-of-type(5n+3) { transform: rotate($turn$turn); }
.$class$:nth-of-type(7n+5) { transform: rotate($turn$turn); }
\end






\define rotate() <<rpn $(index)$ $(amount)$ />>

\define randomnr(class)
.$class$:nth-of-type({{primes##$(index)$}}n) {
  transform: rotate($(index)$0deg);
  background:{{colors##$(index)$}};
}
.$class$:nth-of-type({{primes##$(index)$}}n):after {
  content:"$(index)$"; position:relative; margin-left:-50%;
}
\end

\define myline()
<div class="myline myline-$(index)$"></div>
\end

<br><br>
<$list filter="a b c d e f g h i j k" variable="index">
<div class="myline"></div>
</$list>

<style>
<$list filter="1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9" variable="index">
<$macrocall $name=randomnr class=myline />
</$list>
</style>

.myline:nth-of-type({{primes##$index$}}n) {  transform: rotate($index$turn); }

```
<style>
.myline:nth-of-type(n)       {  transform: rotate(5deg); }
.myline:nth-of-type(2n) {  transform: rotate(10deg); }
.myline:nth-of-type(3n) {  transform: rotate(15deg); }
.myline:nth-of-type(5n) {  transform: rotate(20deg); }
.myline:nth-of-type(7n) {  transform: rotate(25deg); }
</style>
```

<br><br>

<style>
.myline {width:4em; border:1px solid red; height:1em; xposition:absolute}
.Xmyline:nth-of-type(3) {  transform: rotate(10deg); }
</style>






.deftable { margin-left:5%; }
.deftable, .deftable td { border:0; vertical-align:top;}
.deftable tr { border-bottom:1px solid rgba(0,0,0,.05); }
.deftable tr td:first-child {font-weight:bold; vertical-align:top; white-space:nowrap; 
}
.demotable {
  width:100%;
}
.demotable, .demotable td {
  vertical-align:top;
  border:0;
  padding:0;
}






\define getgraphfilter() [tag[$(gr)$]] $:/plugins/telmiger/rpn [tag[graphCore]] [tag[graphCoreComponent]] -[tag[demo]]

\define getgraph(gr)
<$vars gr=$gr$>
<$button class="dragbutton getbutton" dragFilter=<<getgraphfilter>> >
Get! 
<span class="getgraphtip">
Drag'n drop directly into your TW<br>
or go to [[Install]] for details.
</span>
</$button>
</$vars>
\end

<<getgraph line>>







<pre>
/* Mostly for pills in Install tiddler */
.table-install {width:100%;}
.cell-install {
  vertical-align:top;
}
.cell-install-buttons {
  text-align:center;
}

/* dragpills - CRED: https://codepen.io/rzahniser/pen/ONwdQQ */
.dragbutton {
  position: relative;
  width:7em;
  padding:4px;
  font-size:1.1em;
  text-align:center;
  color: white;
  white-space:nowrap;
  text-shadow: 3px 3px 6px black;
  border-radius: 1em;
  background: #019DFF;
  border: none;
  outline: none;
  box-shadow: 2px 2px 5px rgba(0,0,0,0.5),
    5px 8px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.4),
    inset 6px 6px 12px rgba(255,255,255,0.5),
    inset -6px -6px 10px rgba(0,0,0,0.2);
}
.dragbutton::-moz-focus-inner {  border: 0;
}
.dragbutton:after {
  content:"";
  position: absolute;
  top: 2px; left: 6px; right: 6px; height: 10px;
  border-radius: 6px 6px 0 0 / 4px 4px 0 0;
  background: linear-gradient(rgba(255,255,255,0.8),rgba(255,255,255,0.2));
}
.dragbutton:hover {  background: lightgreen;
}
.getbutton {
  width:auto;
  padding:5px;
  float:right;
  font-size:.8em;
  margin:3em; margin-top:0;
  box-shadow:
    2px 2px 3px rgba(0,0,0,0.5),
    3px 4px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.4),
    inset 6px 6px 12px rgba(255,255,255,0.5),
    inset -6px -6px 10px rgba(0,0,0,0.2);
}
.dragbutton .getgraphtip {
    position: absolute;
    z-index: 1;
    top: -5px;
    right: 100%; 
    visibility: hidden;
    background-color: black;
    color: #fff;
    text-align: center;
    border-radius: 6px;
    padding: 5px;
}
.dragbutton:hover .getgraphtip { visibility: visible;
}
.getdemo {margin:0; float:none; box-shadow:none;
}

/* Tweak headings h2, h3, 4h / !!, !!!, !!!! */
.tc-tiddler-body h2 {margin-bottom:-.2em; margin-top:1.2em;}
.tc-tiddler-body h3 {margin-bottom:-.4em; margin-top:1.4em;}
.tc-tiddler-body h4 {margin-bottom:-.6em; margin-top:1.6em; font-weight:bold;}

/* Editor preview remove top spacing */
.tc-tiddler-preview-preview p {margin-top:0;}

/* TW-version added to site title */
.tc-site-title:before {
  content:"TW <<version>>";
  position:absolute;
  margin-top:-1.9em;
  color:silver;
  font-size:13px;
}
/* Remove extra space to right of tagpills in text */
.tc-tag-list-item { margin-right: 0; }
.tc-tags-wrapper .tc-tag-list-item { margin-right: 7px; }
</pre>






\define abs(a, b)
<$set name=res value="<<rpn $a$ $b$ - >>" >
<$wikify name=res text={{{ [<res>!prefix[-]] [<res>prefix[-]removeprefix[-]] }}} >
<<res>>
</$wikify>
</$set> 
\end






\define expander() <div class="expander"></div>







.expander {
  width: 100vw;
  display: table-cell;
}







\define divvv(h)<div style="height:$h$; display:block;"></div>

\define graphspace()
<$macrocall $name=divvv h={{Graph/_Core/Stylesheet!!defaultheight}} />
\end






\define bars() <div class="bars-label bars-$(variant)$-label">$(y)$$(item-3)$x</div>

\define bars-varstyles()
.$(item)$ {
  margin-left:calc($(index0)$ * $(x-step)$% + 10px);
  height:$(y-of-max)$%;
}
\end






.bars {
  position:absolute;
  line-height:0em; /*1.1em*/
  background:pink;
  xoutline:1px solid red;
  bottom:0;
  width:1em;
  box-shadow: 
  inset 10px 0px 0px  rgba(255,255,255,0.3),
  inset 0 1px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.4);
  border-top-right-radius: 3px;
  border-top-left-radius: 4px;
}
.bars p {
  margin:0;
}
.bars:hover a {
  text-decoration:none;
}
.bars-label {
  position:absolute;
  display:inline-block;
  white-space:nowrap;
  margin-top:-.7em;
}






\define chronology() [[$(name)$]]

\define chronology-varstyles() 
.$(item)$ {
  bottom:$(y-of-max)$%;
  width:calc($(x-of-max)$% * .3);
}
\end







.graph .graph-chronology {
  position:relative;
  margin:3em auto;
}
.graph-chronology:before { /* center line */
  content:"\00a0";
  height:100%;
  border-left:2px solid silver;
  position:absolute; 
  margin-left:50%;
  width:0;
}
.chronology {
  margin-bottom:-.4rem;
  line-height:1rem;
  position:absolute;
  white-space:nowrap;
}
.chronology a {
  padding:2px 5px;
  background:white;
  box-shadow: 
    inset 0px 0px 0px  rgba(255,255,255,0.3),
    inset 0 0px 5px rgba(0,0,0,0.4);
  border-radius: 3px;
}
.chronology:nth-of-type(odd) {
  margin-left:50%;
}
.chronology:nth-of-type(even) {
  right:0;
  margin-right:50%;
  direction:rtl;
}
.chronology:before {
  content:"\00a0";
  width:100%;
  display:inline-block; 
 border-bottom:1px solid silver;
line-height:0;
}







\define clock-radius()
<$wikify name=y text={{{ [[$(name)$]has[y]get[y]] [[$(sourcetid)$]has[y]get[y]] [{Graph/_Core/Stylesheet!!defaultheight}removesuffix[vh]] +[first[]] }}} ><<y>></$wikify>
\end

\define clockitem-radius()
<$wikify name=x text={{{ [[$(name)$]has[x]get[x]] [[$(sourcetid)$]get[$(variant)$-x]] [[$(sourcetid)$]get[x]] 7 +[first[]] }}} ><<x>></$wikify>
\end

\define rotate() <<rpn $(index)$ $(amount)$ />>

\define clock()
<div class="clockitem $(variant)$ clock$(-variant)$-clockitem clock$(-variant)$-clockitem-(index)$">
  [[$(name)$]]
</div>
\end

\define clock-varstyles()
.$(graph)$ {
  margin:calc(<<clock-radius>>vw + <<clockitem-radius>>vw) auto;
  transform: translateY(50%);
  width:0;
  position:relative;
}
.$(item)$ {
  position:absolute;
  padding-left:<<clock-radius>>vw;
  transform:rotate(<<rotate>>turn); 
  transform-origin:  0% 100%;
  border:1px solid silver;               /*     "clock arms" from center to item */
  border-right:0;
}
.$(item)$ .clock$(-variant)$-clockitem {
  padding:0 10px;
  position:absolute;
  transform:rotate(-<<rotate>>turn);
  Xoutline:1px  solid blue; 
  text-align:center;
  line-height:0;
  width:<<clockitem-radius>>vw; /* disable for border to adapt to name */
max-width:50vh;
  z-index:2;
}
.$(item)$ .clock$(-variant)$-clockitem:before {
  content:"";
  Xline-height:0;
  position:absolute;
  border:5px solid gray;
  left:-5px;                          /* balance border width */
  border-radius: 50%;
  width: 100%;
  height:<<clockitem-radius>>vw;  /* for oval items change this */
max-height:50vh;
  transform: translateY(-50%);
  z-index:-1;
  word-break: break-all;
}
\end

<style>
.clock-header{
  transform: translate(-50%, -50%) rotate(15deg);
  z-index:1;
  background:white;
  line-height:1em;
  font-size:3em;
  color:crimson;
  font-family: "Comic Sans MS", cursive, sans-serif;
  margin:0;
  width:auto;
}
</style>

|!Under development|

I call it "clock" because the items are evenly distributed "around the clock". Probably more for illustrations than number presentations.

Item ''distance from center is the y-value'' in vw. ''x-value is diameter'' of item, in vw. But, if these fields are missing in the items, it ''falls back on values in the display tiddler'', i.e the tiddler where you show the graph.

The center message is automatically fetched from the display tiddlers `clock-header` field.

An idea would be to use it as a radial coordinate system (term?) and, like [[scatter|Demo Scatter]], have items transcluded. That way, the circle border can be omitted (which it can anyway of course) and instead show whatever the item tiddler shows, for variety and control.

<br>`<<graph "non-linear capture organize customize share" clock>>`
<<graph "non-linear capture organize customize share" clock>>







.graph-confetti {
  position.relative; 
  text-shadow: 0.2em 0.2em /* 0.2em */ silver 
}

.confetti, .confetti a {
  white-space: nowrap;
  xtext-indent: 0;
}






\define gantt()
<div style="left:-$(indent)$; position:absolute; z-index:2">
  $(index)$. [[$(name)$]]
</div>
$(index)$ (dur. $(y)$)
\end

\define gantt-varstyles()
.$(graph)$ {
  height:calc($(amount)$ * $(lineheight)$);
}
.$(item)$ {
  width:$(y-of-total)$%;
  margin-left:$(accshare0)$%;
  background-color:{{$(name)$!!color}};
}
\end

\define gantt-myvariant()
<div style="left:-$(indent)$; position:absolute; z-index:2">
  $(index)$. [[$(name)$]]
</div>
$(index)$ (dur. $(y)$)
\end



|!Under development|

<br>

```
<<graph "[tag[sample]]" gantt>>
<<graph "[tag[sample]]" x-axis accsum>>
```
<br>

<<graph "[tag[sample]limit[5]]" gantt>>
<<graph "[tag[smallsample]limit[5]]" gantt myvariant>>
<<graph "[tag[sample]limit[5]]" x-axis accsum>>

<br>

`y` field = duration.

Color is fetched from the current tiddler but with fallback (pink) set in [[Graph/Gantt/Stylesheet]].

The special x-axis variant is elaborated on in [[Demo x-axis]].

See [[Demo hBars|Demo hBars (horizontal bars)]] for elaboration on how the name list and the graph indentation work.

<style>
.x-axis-accsum-footer {
 font-size:1em;
 text-align:left;
 margin:0 0 .5em -5em; 
}
</style>

  float:right; position:relative;
  margin-bottom:.5em;
}

  line-height:1rem;
  white-space:nowrap;
  text-align:center;

    inset 0px 0px 0px  rgba(255,255,255,0.3),
    inset 0 0px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.4);
  border-radius: 3px;
  background-color:pink;
}

.$(item)$ {
  width:$(y-of-max)$%;
}
\end

  padding-right:3px;
  background:pink; 
  white-space:nowrap;
  box-shadow: 
    inset 0px 0px 0px  rgba(255,255,255,0.3),
    inset 0 0px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.4);
  border-radius: 3px;
  line-height:1em;
}







\define timeline() [[$(name)$]] $(x)$,$(y)$,$(x-max)$

\define timeline-varstyles() 
.$(item)$ {
  left:calc($(x)$ / $(x-max)$ * 100%);
}
.$(item)$:nth-of-type(odd) { 
  top:calc($(y)$0px + 10px);
}
.$(item)$:after,
 .$(item)$:before {
  min-width:$(x)$0px;
}
\end

<style>
.timeline:after,
 .timeline:before {
  border-left:1px solid silver;
}
.timeline:nth-of-type(even):before {
  content:"xxx";
  float:left;
  xmargin-right:10px;
}
.timeline:nth-of-type(odd):after {
  content:"odd";
float:left;
  margin-left:10px;
  xposition:absolute; 
}

.graph .graph-timeline {
  position:relative;
  border-bottom:2px solid silver;
  width:100%;
  margin:auto 0;
}
.timeline {
 xmargin-bottom:-.4rem;
 line-height:1rem;
 white-space:nowrap;
 transform:rotate(90deg)
}
.timeline a { border:1px solid silver; padding:5px; border-radius:5px; background:white;}
</style>
